meanings.definition: The plural form of soma, referring to the cell body of a neuron.
meanings.sent1: Neurons transmit signals through their somata.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the somata of the neuron under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The somata of the neuron threw a party for the dendrites.
meanings.sent4: In the forest of neurons, the somata stood tall like ancient trees.
meanings.sent5: The somata, like tiny command centers, controlled the neuron's functions.

meanings.definition: The plural form of somatum, referring to the body of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The somata of the animals were covered in fur.
meanings.sent2: The somata of the organisms varied in size and shape.
meanings.sent3: The somata of the creatures danced joyfully in the meadow.
meanings.sent4: The somata of the organisms were like the bricks of life's building blocks.
meanings.sent5: The somata, the essence of each organism, held the secrets of their existence.
